text: anyone know if there was change to embedded forms recently which would break submissions? Specifically to email fields? Our testing shows that if we remove just the email field the forms work again
Yup! That’s the expected behavior of nested field groups right now. We’ve started to consider adding more control over how deeply nested field groups are displayed fairly recently… TBD
This message was deleted.
did you download the extension?
oh, are you going to tell me that’s part of the extension? Now I feel dumb
I won’t say it _IS_ a part of it… But if you turn the extension off it _may_ disappear
lol what was/is/should be part of the extension?
the developers tab (he saw it and thought it was new HS functionality)
Which, *cough - it should be!

ahh! I styled the dropdown different in the old nav but didn’t do it with the new nav. I could make that change with the new nav to make it more obvious. (basically wasn’t sure if visually I should keep it looking like the rest of the interface or make it look different to keep it from causing confusion. basically I don’t want it to look gawdy like a lot of extension’s injected content does, but don’t want users to be confused either.)
hmm, it showed up in the new nav for me
The menu does show up in the new nav, what i was meaning is it’s styled the same as other dropdowns
howdy, wondering if you've had any other issues come up with embedded forms?
with the old nav it’s styled slightly different to make it more obvious the extension is doing it
ah gotcha

Hello, do you already have any video of the new CMS developer certification? or when will that be available? I have two people in my team that were thinking in taking the cert, but at inbound they recommended not to do that because it is going down. What videos could I give to them to start working in the CMS before the full certification is available?

There is currently on the certification site a developer focused course, which will be part of the certification.

The course has 2 lessons, but will have more before the certification is available.

You are correct the design cert is going away and it may be a waste of time to get that cert.

If you just want to get them familiar with the new design manager there is an online course thing that was built for internal use at HS which is fairly good (doesn’t have many videos I don’t think) but has good content. I unfortunatley can’t find the link I’m referring to it’s been passed around for a long time so hopefully someone else can chime in with a link

Thanks Jon, yes those should be good!  I've done a search and in the posts that explain that the Design CMS cert is going away the links to those 2 lessons are not available. Any link will be very helpful!
<https://app.HubSpot.com/learning-center>
the track is `CMS for Developers`
Thank you!!!!
<@U7SL518D6> are you referring to this link? <https://rise.articulate.com/share/gL5qPg4wopTBJTJMOQKYrdOoKKbZ8nnA#/?_k=8mnwhn>
yes exactly what i was meaning
I swear I’ve stored this somewhere new every time someone asks about training materials for the new design manager, but can never find where i put it
I pinned it to our company general slack channel
works like a charm!
Thanks <@U26D0TF8E> :slightly_smiling_face:
When will the old design manager be retired?
I’d like to steer more clients toward the new CMS and it would be easier if there was a sunset timeline.
Yep, already migrated. I need to change it on pages too eventually, but this is golden and I’ll test it out. Don’t see why it wouldn’t work. Thanks <@U4RP6AGV9> :thumbsup:

I’m also wondering if templates that contain defunct modules will be removed from the marketplace. We’re starting to encounter issues where we’re having to put in work to get marketplace templates working with the new manager. Also getting into battles with clients where they keep converting the portal back to the old DM and we keep rolling it forward.
Don’t they see how NICE the new DM is????

Perhaps they need a good talking to, if you don’t mind my saying so. Perhaps a bit more. My clients, sir, they didn’t care for the new Design Manager at first. One of them actually rolled it back, and tried to burn it down. But I “corrected” them sir. And when my PM tried to prevent me from doing my duty, I “corrected” him.
If this is a reference, I missed it - If this isn’t a reference, please don’t lobotomize me as well
The Shining!
_Woosh_ never seen it :grimacing:
Oh man, that’s the greatest horror movie ever made in my opinion.
And top 10 any genre in my opinion
